artifacts.content:
{
  "market_analysis": {
    "tam": {
      "value": "$1.2 billion",
      "calculation": "Estimated global market for DevOps tooling (Gartner 2025) + adjacent CI/CD and build management tools",
      "source_type": "industry_report"
    },
    "sam": {
      "value": "$320 million",
      "calculation": "TAM filtered for enterprise/power-user DevOps teams (20% of global DevOps market)",
      "geographic_scope": "Global"
    },
    "som": {
      "value": "$48 million",
      "calculation": "15% of SAM achievable in Year 1 with strong enterprise sales and developer community",
      "assumptions": [
        "Rapid enterprise adoption of Next-gen build tooling",
        "Leverage existing OLYMPUS user base",
        "Integrates with popular CI/CD pipelines"
      ]
    },
    "growth_rate": "18% CAGR",
    "market_stage": "growing",
    "timing_assessment": "DevOps tooling market is rapidly expanding, with increasing demand for visibility and control over complex build pipelines. Now is an optimal time to enter with a differentiated product."
  },
  "competitors": [
    {
      "name": "Jenkins",
      "type": "direct",
      "description": "Open-source CI/CD server for automating builds",
      "strengths": [
        "Mature and widely adopted",
        "Extensive plugin ecosystem",
        "Customizable"
      ],
      "weaknesses": [
        "Steep learning curve",
        "Lacks modern UX",
        "Self-hosted only"
      ],
      "pricing": "Open-source (self-hosted)",
      "market_share_estimate": "35% of enterprise DevOps teams",
      "key_differentiator": "De facto standard for CI/CD pipelines",
      "threat_level": "high"
    },
    {
      "name": "GitHub Actions",
      "type": "direct",
      "description": "Workflow automation built into GitHub",
      "strengths": [
        "Tight GitHub integration",
        "Serverless and scalable",
        "Free for open-source"
      ],
      "weaknesses": [
        "Limited to GitHub ecosystem",
        "Less customization options",
        "Opinionated workflows"
      ],
      "pricing": "Free for open-source, $0.008-$0.12/min for private repos",
      "market_share_estimate": "25% of enterprise DevOps teams",
      "key_differentiator": "GitHub-native CI/CD",
      "threat_level": "medium"
    },
    {
      "name": "Azure Pipelines",
      "type": "direct",
      "description": "CI/CD service from Microsoft",
      "strengths": [
        "Enterprise-grade features",
        "Integrates with Azure DevOps",
        "Scalable and reliable"
      ],
      "weaknesses": [
        "Lock-in to Azure ecosystem",
        "Pricing based on build minutes",
        "Limited customization"
      ],
      "pricing": "$40/user/month + $0.004-$0.08/build-minute",
      "market_share_estimate": "20% of enterprise DevOps teams",
      "key_differentiator": "Microsoft-backed enterprise solution",
      "threat_level": "medium"
    }
  ],
  "trends": [
    {
      "trend": "Shift to cloud-based DevOps tooling",
      "type": "technology",
      "impact": "Enterprises seek SaaS-based build management solutions that are scalable, reliable, and easy to set up",
      "timeline": "Current",
      "confidence": "high"
    },
    {
      "trend": "Demand for build visibility and traceability",
      "type": "consumer",
      "impact": "DevOps teams need better insights into their build pipelines to troubleshoot issues and ensure compliance",
      "timeline": "Current",
      "confidence": "high"
    },
    {
      "trend": "Increasing adoption of low-code/no-code tools",
      "type": "technology",
      "impact": "Developers and non-technical users seek more user-friendly build management interfaces",
      "timeline": "1-2 years",
      "confidence": "medium"
    }
  ],
  "swot": {
    "strengths": [
      "Tight integration with OLYMPUS ecosystem",
      "Modern, visually-driven UX for build management",
      "Leverages latest React and Next.js capabilities"
    ],
    "weaknesses": [
      "New entrant in a crowded market",
      "Needs to build a strong developer community",
      "Potential for vendor lock-in concerns"
    ],
    "opportunities": [
      "Underserved need for build visibility and traceability",
      "Differentiate with enterprise-grade features and compliance focus",
      "Expand into low-code/no-code build automation"
    ],
    "threats": [
      "Established players like Jenkins and GitHub Actions have large user bases",
      "Azure Pipelines' Microsoft backing could make it hard to compete in enterprise segment"
    ]
  },
  "opportunities": [
    "Provide a visually-driven, user-friendly build management experience that improves visibility and traceability",
    "Integrate deeply with the OLYMPUS ecosystem to offer a seamless end-to-end development workflow"
  ],
  "risks": [
    {
      "risk": "Difficulty building a strong developer community to drive adoption",
      "probability": "medium",
      "impact": "high",
      "mitigation": "Invest heavily in developer outreach, evangelism, and community-building efforts"
    },
    {
      "risk": "Enterprises hesitant to adopt a new build management tool due to vendor lock-in concerns",
      "probability": "medium",
      "impact": "medium",
      "mitigation": "Emphasize open standards, API-first design, and easy migration paths"
    }
  ],
  "recommendation": {
    "market_attractiveness": "8/10 - Rapidly growing market with clear gaps, OLYMPUS ecosystem provides strong advantages",
    "entry_timing": "now",
    "key_success_factors": [
      "Seamless OLYMPUS integration",
      "Enterprise-grade features and compliance",
      "Visually-driven, user-friendly UX",
      "Strong developer community engagement"
    ]
  }
}

{
  "mvp_definition": {
    "core_value_proposition": "A comprehensive build monitoring dashboard that provides real-time visibility and insights into the OLYMPUS build process for development teams.",
    "target_user": "Developers and engineering managers responsible for overseeing the OLYMPUS build pipeline",
    "key_differentiator": "Combines build status, agent progress, and constitutional compliance in a single pane of glass, enabling teams to quickly identify and resolve issues."
  },
  "mvp_features": [
    {
      "id": "build_list",
      "name": "Build List",
      "category": "core",
      "priority": "must_have",
      "rice_score": 90,
      "rice_breakdown": {
        "reach": 9,
        "impact": 9,
        "confidence": 9,
        "effort": 7
      },
      "description": "Displays a list of all active and completed builds, including status indicators, timestamps, and duration.",
      "user_story": "As a developer, I want to see a comprehensive list of all builds, so that I can quickly understand the current state of the OLYMPUS system."
    },
    {
      "id": "phase_progression",
      "name": "Phase Progression",
      "category": "core",
      "priority": "must_have",
      "rice_score": 88,
      "rice_breakdown": {
        "reach": 9,
        "impact": 9,
        "confidence": 8,
        "effort": 7
      },
      "description": "Provides a visual timeline of the build process, showing the status of each phase (discovery, design, architecture, etc.) and the corresponding start and end times.",
      "user_story": "As an engineering manager, I want to see the progress of the build process across all phases, so that I can identify bottlenecks and optimize the workflow."
    },
    {
      "id": "agent_roster",
      "name": "Agent Roster",
      "category": "core",
      "priority": "must_have",
      "rice_score": 85,
      "rice_breakdown": {
        "reach": 8,
        "impact": 8,
        "confidence": 9,
        "effort": 7
      },
      "description": "Displays a list of all agents involved in the build process, their current status, and the tasks they are working on.",
      "user_story": "As a developer, I want to see the status and progress of each agent, so that I can understand the overall health of the build and identify any potential issues."
    },
    {
      "id": "constitutional_status",
      "name": "Constitutional Status",
      "category": "core",
      "priority": "must_have",
      "rice_score": 82,
      "rice_breakdown": {
        "reach": 8,
        "impact": 8,
        "confidence": 8,
        "effort": 7
      },
      "description": "Provides a traffic light system to indicate the compliance status of key constitutional articles, including explanations for any warnings or violations.",
      "user_story": "As an engineering manager, I want to see the constitutional compliance status of the build, so that I can ensure the build process adheres to the OLYMPUS guidelines."
    },
    {
      "id": "understanding_panel",
      "name": "Understanding Your Build",
      "category": "supporting",
      "priority": "should_have",
      "rice_score": 75,
      "rice_breakdown": {
        "reach": 7,
        "impact": 8,
        "confidence": 8,
        "effort": 6
      },
      "description": "Offers insights into the build, including a summary of the generated components/files, the key decisions and reasoning behind them, and any known risks.",
      "user_story": "As a developer, I want to understand the rationale and potential issues behind the build, so that I can better maintain and improve the OLYMPUS system."
    },
    {
      "id": "contextual_chat",
      "name": "Contextual Chat",
      "category": "supporting",
      "priority": "should_have",
      "rice_score": 70,
      "rice_breakdown": {
        "reach": 7,
        "impact": 7,
        "confidence": 8,
        "effort": 7
      },
      "description": "Allows users to ask questions and receive information related to the currently selected build.",
      "user_story": "As a developer, I want to be able to ask questions and get clarification about the current build, so that I can better understand and address any issues that arise."
    }
  ],
  "roadmap": {
    "phase_1_mvp": {
      "duration": "4-6 weeks",
      "features": [
        "build_list",
        "phase_progression",
        "agent_roster",
        "constitutional_status"
      ],
      "milestone": "Usable build monitoring dashboard"
    },
    "phase_2_enhance": {
      "duration": "2-4 weeks",
      "features": [
        "understanding_panel"
      ],
      "milestone": "Improved build understanding and insights"
    },
    "phase_3_scale": {
      "duration": "ongoing",
      "features": [
        "contextual_chat"
      ],
      "milestone": "Enhanced collaboration and support"
    }
  },
  "technical_requirements": {
    "stack": {
      "frontend": "Next.js 14 + React 18 + TypeScript + Tailwind CSS",
      "backend": "Next.js API Routes",
      "database": "Supabase",
      "auth": "Supabase Auth"
    },
    "integrations": [
      "Supabase for real-time data updates",
      "Lucide React for icons"
    ],
    "performance": {
      "initial_load": "<3s",
      "interaction_response": "<500ms",
      "lighthouse_target": ">90"
    },
    "security": [
      "HTTPS",
      "JWT tokens for API authentication",
      "Input sanitization"
    ]
  },
  "success_criteria": {
    "launch_requirements": [
      "All critical features functional",
      "No TypeScript errors",
      "Responsive design for desktop",
      "Core user flows completable end-to-end"
    ],
    "validation_metrics": [
      "Users can access build details and monitor progress in under 2 minutes",
      "Zero critical bugs in core user flows",
      "Positive user feedback on dashboard usefulness and insights"
    ]
  },
  "featureChecklist": {
    "critical": [
      {
        "id": "build_list",
        "name": "Build List",
        "description": "Displays a list of all active and completed builds, including status indicators, timestamps, and duration.",
        "acceptanceCriteria": [
          "Fetches build data from /api/builds endpoint",
          "Displays a list of builds with columns for status, timestamp, and duration",
          "Supports sorting and filtering of builds (e.g., by status, timestamp)",
          "Clicking on a build navigates to the build detail page",
          "Provides visual indicators for build status (queued, running, completed, failed)"
        ],
        "assignedTo": "pixel",
        "priority": 1,
        "rice_score": 90
      },
      {
        "id": "phase_progression",
        "name": "Phase Progression",
        "description": "Provides a visual timeline of the build process, showing the status of each phase (discovery, design, architecture, etc.) and the corresponding start and end times.",
        "acceptanceCriteria": [
          "Fetches build phase data from /api/builds/[buildId] endpoint",
          "Displays a horizontal timeline with phases (discovery, design, architecture, etc.)",
          "Each phase shows its status (pending, active, completed, failed)",
          "Provides start and end timestamps for each phase",
          "Highlights the currently active phase"
        ],
        "assignedTo": "pixel",
        "priority": 2,
        "rice_score": 88
      },
      {
        "id": "agent_roster",
        "name": "Agent Roster",
        "description": "Displays a list of all agents involved in the build process, their current status, and the tasks they are working on.",
        "acceptanceCriteria": [
          "Fetches agent data from /api/ai/agents endpoint",
          "Displays a list of all agents organized by build phase",
          "Each agent shows their name, role, current status, and the task they are working on",
          "Provides visual indicators for agent status (idle, working, completed, failed)",
          "Allows filtering agents by status"
        ],
        "assignedTo": "pixel",
        "priority": 3,
        "rice_score": 85
      },
      {
        "id": "constitutional_status",
        "name": "Constitutional Status",
        "description": "Provides a traffic light system to indicate the compliance status of key constitutional articles, including explanations for any warnings or violations.",
        "acceptanceCriteria": [
          "Fetches constitutional status data from /api/builds/[buildId] endpoint",
          "Displays a maximum of 7 constitutional articles with their status (compliant, warning, violation)",
          "Uses a traffic light system (green, yellow, red) to indicate the status",
          "Provides a one-sentence explanation for each article's status",
          "Allows expanding an article to see more detailed information"
        ],
        "assignedTo": "pixel",
        "priority": 4,
        "rice_score": 82
      }
    ],
    "important": [
      {
        "id": "understanding_panel",
        "name": "Understanding Your Build",
        "description": "Offers insights into the build, including a summary of the generated components/files, the key decisions and reasoning behind them, and any known risks.",
        "acceptanceCriteria": [
          "Fetches build metadata from /api/builds/[buildId] endpoint",
          "Displays a summary of the generated components and files",
          "Provides an explanation of the key decisions made during the build process",
          "Lists any known risks or issues associated with the build"
        ],
        "assignedTo": "pixel",
        "priority": 5,
        "rice_score": 75
      },
      {
        "id": "contextual_chat",
        "name": "Contextual Chat",
        "description": "Allows users to ask questions and receive information related to the currently selected build.",
        "acceptanceCriteria": [
          "Provides a collapsible side panel for the chat functionality",
          "Automatically displays the chat panel when a build is selected",
          "Allows users to enter questions or comments about the current build",
          "Responds with relevant information from the build metadata",
          "Supports basic natural language processing to understand user queries"
        ],
        "assignedTo": "pixel",
        "priority": 6,
        "rice_score": 70
      }
    ],
    "niceToHave": []
  },
  "risks": [
    {
      "risk": "Integrating real-time data updates from Supabase",
      "probability": "medium",
      "impact": "high",
      "mitigation": "Thoroughly test the Supabase integration and implement robust error handling and fallback mechanisms."
    },
    {
      "risk": "Complexity of the constitutional status feature",
      "probability": "medium",
      "impact": "medium",
      "mitigation": "Carefully design the data model and user interface to ensure the feature is intuitive and easy to understand."
    },
    {
      "risk": "Potential performance issues with large build histories",
      "probability": "low",
      "impact": "medium",
      "mitigation": "Implement pagination, infinite scrolling, and efficient data fetching techniques to optimize the build list performance."
    }
  ]
}

decisions.choice: {"pattern":"monolith","reasoning":"The project requires a straightforward Build Console with a limit
decisions.reasoning: The project requires a straightforward Build Console with a limited number of entities (builds, agents, constitutional checks). A monolithic architecture minimizes complexity and allows for rapid development, which is essential for the MVP phase.
